item.title: ROP On x64: What's ret2csu Again?
item.description: Based on the Stop, ROP, n', Roll challenge from this year’s Redpwn CTF, this post will explain how to make system calls on x64 using ROP in order to spawn a shell. Also, it shows how to abuse writable memory regions of a process to overcome difficulties with some ROP gadgets. And the best thing is, two of the gadgets used in this writeup are universal and most likely also present in your x64 target if it’s using glibc.
